intro: Properly-folded boxer briefs can save precious space in your drawers or suitcase, and help you stay organized. There are a few different techniques to accomplish this. For ideal storage in a drawer, flatten the boxer briefs out. For a more stackable result, fold the underwear into a square. Finally, for maximum space saving, use the Ranger Roll method to pack everything efficiently.

steps.title: Tuck the bottom half into the waistband.
steps.subtitle: Take the bottom half of the underwear in one hand and hold the waistband open with the other hand. Fold the bottom up and tuck it into the waistband. Keep inserting the fabric until the waistband forms the bottom line of the boxer briefs. You’ll now have a nice neat square.
sub-points: Press down on the underwear one more time to flatten them out and make sure there are no more wrinkles.
This fold gives you a flat result that is good for packing.

points.name: Folding the Underwear into a Square

steps.title: Fold the crotch side in thirds twice.
steps.subtitle: Take the underwear by the crotch side and fold it up into a third. Then fold it once more so the crotch side meets the waistband. Press down once more to work out any air and wrinkles.
sub-points: This fold won’t give you the flattest result, but more of a box. This is stackable in drawers or on a shelf.

steps.title: Tuck the rolled portion into the waistband.
steps.subtitle: Once you reach the waistband, hold the rolled part with one hand and hold the waistband open your other hand. Tuck the rolled part inside the waistband. Pull the waistband down a bit so the rolled part is secure.
sub-points: The Ranger Roll is designed for maximum space saving. Use it if you have a lot to pack and need to make the most of your space.
